data.title: Foundation of the Victoria Memorial
data.meta_description: A sandwich of our history with our former colonisers, the foundation of the hall was laid on this day as a memorial to Queen Victoria and is now a hub of historical knowledge and rare exhibitions.
data.text:
Designed by Sir William Emerson, foreseen by Lord Curzon and inaugurated by Prince of Wales, King George V, himself, this white-marble grandiose was built between 1906 and 1921, dedicated to the deceased Queen Victoria to commemorate her 25 year reign as the Empress of India. Currently a museum under the Ministry of Culture, it still stands proudly on the Maidan (grounds) beside the bank of the Hooghly River, near Chowringhee Road or the Jawaharlal Nehru Road.

You can view virtual exhibitions of the memorial at here.
